tweets.text:
And now we know why government have been so busy over the last couple of days.

In 2019 water companies spent over 3,100,000 hours, on over 400,000 occasions dumping sh*t into our rivers and seas.

And the @EnvAgency does what exactly?

https://t.co/sUsBYs5msz

I am reaching out to @EmmaHowardBoyd and @JamesBevanEA for help. I can‚Äôt seem to get anywhere with this. The @EnvAgency just don‚Äôt seen to recognise there is an issue on the River Mardyke. If anyone else knows how we can resolve this @HertsFarmer @InnesThomson https://t.co/AaTqYyV57K

@AndyWoodturner @Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency Our water company posts their annual goals a week after they report their annual findings. Amazingly, over the past 22 years they‚Äôve always matched up 100%. ü§¶üèΩ

Did you know that the construction and demolition industry generates 62% of all waste in the UK? 

That's why we're working with builders and developers to ensure this type of waste is disposed of correctly to avoid damage to the environment. 

Read more: https://t.co/lSYFBvICBL

urls.title: Event duration monitoring ‚Äì lifting the lid on storm overflows
urls.description: On today's blog we look into the 2020 Event Duration Monitoring Data, which is fundamental to understanding and improving the environment.¬†

tweets.text:
Storm overflows performance data to inland and coastal waters has been published for all water companies in England.

For information on storm overflows and a link to the full data and a summary of the key statistics, read our blog post: https://t.co/51zRnT2fSi https://t.co/cLtFlAR7jt

Water firms discharged raw sewage into English waters 400,000 times last year 

 - Data published for first time by @EnvAgency shows 27% increase from previous year

Story by @sandralaville 

https://t.co/tQrV1IVHnQ

We are responding to a serious fish kill at Newton-Le-Willows #StHelens. Our officers & @sthelenscouncil are investigating the cause & taking action to avoid any further fish deaths

Our thanks go to the fast-acting members of the public who reported this to us on 0800 80 70 60

üèóÔ∏è Data gathering works are continuing in #Kendal this week as part of Phase One of the Flood Risk Management Scheme.

The team will be on Aynam Road in the town until the end of the week.

If you haven't already, visit https://t.co/cnCGh6BCJN for more info on the scheme.
@Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency Oh! Oh! I think I know this one! Is it...is it, fuck all?

@TamsinHill1 @RiverActionUK @SalmonTroutCons @HantsIWWildlife @AquiferChalk Hello Tamsin, thanks for getting in touch. I have sent this over to the relevant team, I will get back to you when they reply.
